titleStmt.title: Letter from Debacey to the Minister of Colonies, May 23, 1899

bibl.title: Letter from Debacey to the Minister of Colonies

div1.ab: Direction of the Consulats and Commercial Affairs
Demand of a letter of recommendation for the mentions of an american scientific mission./.

MINISTER OF THE COLONIES
OFFICE OF AFRICA
Direction of the Affairs of Africa
div1.p:
Mister Minister and dear colleage,
Columbia University, the teaching establishment important of the United States; a scientific having by object of to zoological studies it of the coasts of West Africa.

In communicating to me this information, Mr. Ambassador of the United States make me that this american mission must to St. Louis from Senegal and he me the desire to obtain a letter recommending to Mr. General Governor of the West Coast of Africa in St Louis the members of this expedition, who must leave towards the of the current month of May.

I will be obliged to you to put me in measure of satisfying the demand of Mr. General Porter, in addressing to me, the most possible, the letter of recommendation of which it is question. The american mission leaving very shortly the United States, I would attach to be able to respond, in the shortest delay, to Mr. ambassador of the United States

Accept, Mister Minister and dear colleague, the of a high consideration.
Debacey
